hero.title: Welcome to
hero.subtitle: Kwau Village
hero.description: Kwau Village, located in Mokwam District, Manokwari Regency, West Papua, is known as a conservation forest area with extraordinary biodiversity, especially Papua's endemic birds. Besides being a natural habitat for various rare species, Kwau Village also has great potential as a nature-based tourism destination that attracts both local and international tourists.

bananaTree.title: Giant Forest Banana Tree (Musa Ingens W.Simmonds)
bananaTree.description: Kwau Village is home to giant forest banana trees, which are one of Papua's endemic species. These banana trees can grow up to 20 meters tall and have very large leaves.

birdWatching.title: Bird Watching
birdWatching.subtitle: Papua's Endemic Birds
birdWatching.description: The main attraction of Kwau Village is Papua's endemic birds, including the Western Parotia, which can be enjoyed through bird watching activities. Kwau Village is home to various rare and exotic Papua endemic bird species.
birdWatching.speciesTitle: Bird Species That Can Be Observed:
birdWatching.parotia: Bird of paradise with charming feathers
birdWatching.rajaPapuaDesc: One of the most beautiful birds in the world
birdWatching.mambrukDesc: Crown pigeon with its own uniqueness
birdWatching.kasuariDesc: Large bird that cannot fly but is very unique

butterflies.title: Butterfly Diversity
butterflies.description: Kwau Village is home to various beautiful and diverse butterfly species, making it an attractive place for butterfly observation.

waterfall.title: Waterfall
waterfall.description: The waterfall in Kwau Village is an amazing natural attraction, offering spectacular views and a soothing atmosphere.

orchids.title: Various Orchid Plants
orchids.description: Orchids are one of the ornamental plants that are highly sought after by the community. In Kwau Village, there are various types of orchids that grow lushly and beautifully.

dance.title: Tumbu Tanah Dance
dance.description: Kwau Village also offers a rich cultural experience, including traditional dances originating from the Arfak tribe, namely the Tumbu Tanah Dance. This dance is an important part of local community culture and is often performed in traditional ceremonies.

house.title: Centipede House
house.description: The Centipede House is one of the unique attractions in Kwau Village. This house is made of wood and has a distinctive design, with many supporting pillars that resemble centipede legs.

kopi.title: Kwau Coffee
kopi.description: Kwau Village, located in Mokwam District, Manokwari Regency, is not only known as a world-renowned birdwatching destination, but also holds extraordinary local potential in the agricultural sectorâ€”especially coffee.

sayur.title: Vegetable
sayur.description: Kwau Village is renowned not only for its natural beauty and diverse birdlife, but also for its fresh, natural produce. Locals grow a variety of vegetables, including mustard greens, cabbage, spinach, tomatoes, carrots, chilies, tubers, and many more, in small gardens around their homes and on the mountain slopes.
